sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: SLIME (Superior Lisp Interaction Mode for Emacs) provides a development environment for Common Lisp in Emacs. This article assumes that SBCL will be used. It can be replaced with other implementations, e.g. CMUCL, ECL, CLISP.

sections.title: Installation
sections.content: Install emacs-slime and your preferred Common Lisp implementation. Alternatively, SLIME can be installed via quicklisp.

sections.title: Configuration
sections.content:
To make use of SLIME, add the following lines to your init file:

```
(setq inferior-lisp-program "/path/to/lisp-executable")
(add-to-list 'load-path "/usr/share/emacs/site-lisp/slime/")
(require 'slime)
(slime-setup)
```

Then run M-x slime from within emacs.

Alternatively, for a fancier SLIME setup, you can change the above lines to:

```
(setq inferior-lisp-program "/path/to/lisp-executable")
(add-to-list 'load-path "/usr/share/emacs/site-lisp/slime/")
(require 'slime)
(slime-setup '(slime-fancy))
```
